definition: to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])

to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

sentences.english: She tantalized the kitten with fish.
And in some perfumes is there more delight.
sentences.chinese: 有許多芳香非常逗引人喜歡。

sentences.english: The kid is acting up for our attention.
sentences.chinese: 這個孩子正在做各種動作來逗引我們注意。

sentences.english: He drew her on to tell him about what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 他逗引她告訴他所發生的事情。

definition: to tease/to provoke/to play with (a child, animal etc)
to tease/to make fun of/to provoke/to stir up (trouble)
to caress/to fondle/to look after (tenderly)/affectionate care
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to nod one's head and wag one's tail (idiom)/to be well pleased with oneself/to have a lighthearted air
to rotate/to twirl/to run around/to encircle/rotation/(coll.) to speak indirectly/to beat about the bush
